map.MapOverlay.name: map.MapOverlay
map.MapOverlay.description:
This class implements the map pop-out overlay view that lets the user place a piece on the map.  
		It inherits from misc.BaseOverlay.
It calls the "cancelMove" function on the controller it belongs to.

params.name: x
params.description: The x location

params.name: y
params.description: The y location

map.VertexLoc.name: map.VertexLoc
map.VertexLoc.description: This class defines a vertex location as used by view. It uses a unique representation for each vertex

params.name: x
params.description: The x location of the hex the vertex is on

params.name: y
params.description: The y location of the hex the vertex is on

params.name: dir
params.description: The location of the vertex on the hex (allowed values:"E", "W")

map.EdgeLoc.name: map.EdgeLoc
map.EdgeLoc.description: This class defines an edge location as used by view. It uses a unique representation for each edge

params.name: x
params.description: The x location of the hex the edge is on

params.name: y
params.description: The y location of the hex the edge is on

params.name: dir
params.description: The location of the edge on the hex (allowed values:"SW", "S", "SE")

map.PortLoc.name: map.PortLoc
map.PortLoc.description: This class defines a port location as used by view. It uses a unique representation for each port location/orientation.

params.name: x
params.description: The x location of the hex the port is on

params.name: y
params.description: The y location of the hex the port is on

params.name: rotation
params.description: The rotation of the port

map.MapView.name: map.MapView
map.MapView.description:
You need to pass in how many pixels tall/wide the map is 
and how many hexes tall/wide the map is 
(the hex dim can be calculated from the client model)

params.name: pixelDim
params.description: the height of the map measured in pixels

params.name: hexDim
params.description: the height of the map measured in hexes

map.RobberOverlay.name: map.RobberOverlay
map.RobberOverlay.description:
This class implements the overlay view that lets the user select a player to rob.  
It displays a list of other users who can be robbed, and lets the user select which one they want to rob.
		It inherits from misc.BaseOverlay.
Its controller should be set to a MapController, on which it calls the "robPlayer" method.

models.ClientModel.name: models.ClientModel
models.ClientModel.description: This the top-level client model class that contains the local player, map contents, etc.

params.name: playerID
params.description: The id of the local player, extracted from the cookie

hexgrid.BasicHex.name: hexgrid.BasicHex
hexgrid.BasicHex.description:
This class serves as the basis for the different hexes (water, desert, resource)
You should extend this class - in you're constructor, pass in the proper edge and vertex classes 
(they should extend the hexgrid.BaseContainer class)

params.name: location
params.description: - the location of the hex

params.name: EdgeClass
params.description: - the class (NOT AN INSTANCE) you use for an edge - must have an empty constructor

params.name: VertexClass
params.description: - the class (NOT AN INSTANCE) you use for an vertex - must have an empty constructor

hexgrid.EdgeDirection.name: hexgrid.EdgeDirection
hexgrid.EdgeDirection.description:
Use this class to look up the numerical value of a EdgeDirection from JSON.
	These are the edge values in clockwise order starting at NW.
	They are in order so that modulo math makes this easy
	Edge and Vertex Directions give you the edge and then the vertex in clockwise order
It's really just an enumeration. For example EdgeDirection["NW"] or EdgeDirection.NW returns 0;
The possible edge directions are "NW","N","NE","SE","S","SW"

hexgrid.HexDirection.name: hexgrid.HexDirection
hexgrid.HexDirection.description:
These are simply a copy of EdgeDirections. They can be fed to a hexgrid.HexLocation to get 
the location of the hex next to it in that direction. It's really just an enumeration.

hexgrid.VertexDirection.name: hexgrid.VertexDirection
hexgrid.VertexDirection.description:
Use this class to look up the numerical value of a VertexDirection from JSON.
	These are the vertex values in clockwise order starting at NW.
	They are in order so that modulo math makes this easy
	Edge and Vertex Directions give you the edge and then the vertex in clockwise order.
It's really just an enumeration. For example VertexDirection["NW"] or VertexDirection.NW returns 1;
The possible VertexDirection are "W","NW","NE","E","SE","SW"

hexgrid.HexGrid.name: hexgrid.HexGrid
hexgrid.HexGrid.description:
This class will never be directly used by anything other than the map.
It's purpose is to present an array-like interface for hex storage, 
as well as reducing wasted space that naturally incurs. It also provides
a clean interface for generating the initial tiles.

This takes the length of 3 connected sides and returns a hexagonal
grid object. Of necessity, two of the three dimensions must be 
the same - this generates a hexagon that is symmetrical along two axis.
This is perhaps overkill, but the implementation provides insight into 
how hexagonal grids work.

You'll want to use the static method 'getRegular' which takes radius and the prototype of your hex

params.name: bWidth
params.description: The length (width) of the bottom edge in tiles

params.name: lDiagonal
params.description: The length of the lower right diagonal edge in tiles

params.name: rDiagonal
params.description: The length of the lower left diagonal edge in tiles

params.name: x0
params.description: The x offset from the lower left corner for to place (0,0)

params.name: y0
params.description: The y offset from the lower left corner to place (0,0)

params.name: hexClass
params.description: The constructor for a hex.

hexgrid.HexLocation.name: hexgrid.HexLocation
hexgrid.HexLocation.description: This represents a location of a hex on a hex grid.

hexgrid.BaseLocation.name: hexgrid.BaseLocation
hexgrid.BaseLocation.description:
This is the base class for VertexLocation and EdgeLocation
        * 
        * -- This is NOT instantiable by itself --
        *

hexgrid.EdgeLocation.name: hexgrid.EdgeLocation
hexgrid.EdgeLocation.description:
This class represent an edge location. It consists of a hex location
and an edge direction
    This takes a hex location and a direction. Alternatively you can use
     (x,y,direction)

params.name: hexLocation
params.description: The location of the parent hex

params.name: direction
params.description: The direction of the edge relative to the hex

hexgrid.VertexLocation.name: hexgrid.VertexLocation
hexgrid.VertexLocation.description:
This class represents a vertex location. It consists of a hex location
and a vertex direction. Instead of (hexLocation, direction) you can use
    (x, y, direction).

params.name: hexLocation
params.description: The location of the parent hex

params.name: direction
params.description: The direction of the vertex relative to the hex

hexgrid.BaseContainer.name: hexgrid.BaseContainer
hexgrid.BaseContainer.description:
This class represents a base container (to be used for Edge or Vertex). You'll need to pass a child-class (the constructor/
    class, not an instance) to the BasicHex constructor so that it knows how to store stuff. This is the default implementation
    which provides the the abstract the minimum functions. Extends this class to make an Edge/Vertex container class.

models.CatanEdge.name: models.CatanEdge
models.CatanEdge.description:
This class represents an edge. It inherits from BaseContainer.
    The data in this class (that you get from the JSON model) is independent of the hexgrid, except for the location.
    Therefore, we leave it up to you to decide how to implement it.
    It must however implement one function that the hexgrid looks for: 'isOccupied' - look at its documentation.
    From the JSON, this object will have two properties: location, and ownerID.
    Besides the 'isOccupied' method, you may add any other methods that you need.

models.CatanVertex.name: models.CatanVertex
models.CatanVertex.description:
This class represents a Hex. You may add any methods that you need (e.g., to get the resource/hex type, etc.)
    
    In order to work with the hexgrid, this class must extend hexgrid.BasicHex (already done in the code). You also need to implement
    a CatanVertex and CatanEdge classes (stubs are provided in this file).  Look at their documentation to see what needs to be done there.
     
    The hexgrid will be passed an instance of this class to use as a model, and will pull the constructor from that instance. 
    (The core.forceInherit sets the constructor, in case you are curious how that works)

params.name: location
params.description: - the location of this hex. It's used to generate locations for the vertexes and edges.

misc.GameFinishedView.name: misc.GameFinishedView
misc.GameFinishedView.description: A view to display the results of the game; inherits from misc.BaseOverlay

points.PointView.name: points.PointView
points.PointView.description: This class provides a victory point tracker view

resources.ResourceBarController.name: resources.ResourceBarController
resources.ResourceBarController.description: Controller class for the Resources View.

params.name: view
params.description: The resource view

params.name: clientModel
params.description: The client model

params.name: actions
params.description: The actions to take for each user input. The value of actions.elem_name is a function that is called when the specific element is selected (accessed by calling actions["elem_name"]).  The valid element names are defined in StudentDefinitions.js

resources.ResourceBarView.name: resources.ResourceBarView
resources.ResourceBarView.description:
View to display client player's current resources: 
	Resources (wood, sheep, ore, brick, wheat) and 
	Buyable Options (houses, roads, cities). 
It also includes:
	Option to buy a Development card
 Option to play a Development card
	The number of armies the player has used
It calls the following controller methods: "buildRoad", "buildSettlement", "buildCity", "buyCard", "playCard"

roll.RollView.name: roll.RollView
roll.RollView.description:
A view for rolling the dice.  It inherits from misc.BaseOverlay.
It calls the "rollDice" method on its controller if the user clicks the "Roll" button.

roll.RollResultView.name: roll.RollResultView
roll.RollResultView.description:
A view for displaying the result of a roll.  It inherits from misc.BaseOverlay.
It calls the "closeResult" method on its controller when the user clicks the "Okay" button.

domestic.AcceptView.name: domestic.AcceptView
domestic.AcceptView.description: A view for accepting a trade from a player.  It inherits from misc.BaseOverlay.

domestic.DomesticView.name: domestic.DomesticView
domestic.DomesticView.description: A view for setting up trades between players.

maritime.MaritimeView.name: maritime.MaritimeView
maritime.MaritimeView.description: A view for setting up trades between the client player and the bank.

turntracker.TurnTrackerController.name: turntracker.TurnTrackerController
turntracker.TurnTrackerController.description: The controller class for the Turn Tracker

params.description: The view for this object to control.

turntracker.TurnTrackerView.name: turntracker.TurnTrackerView
turntracker.TurnTrackerView.description:
A view that is used for displaying the current state of the game:
1) a table that displays each player's basic information and highlights the current turn,
2) a button to display the game state

misc.BaseController.name: misc.BaseController
misc.BaseController.description:
This class serves as the basis for all controller classes.		
This constructor should be called by all child classes.

params.name: clientModel

misc.BaseOverlay.name: misc.BaseOverlay
misc.BaseOverlay.description: This class is the base class for all overlay view classes.

misc.WaitOverlay.name: misc.WaitOverlay
misc.WaitOverlay.description:
This class implements a placeholder overlay to enforce a wait period.
It inherits from misc.BaseOverlay.
It does not call any controller methods.

core.Core.name: core.Core
core.Core.description: This really isn't a class. These are actually standalone functions.

a list of objects with three attributes: source(the player name attached to the event),
message(the contents of the line), and className(the color of the object)

classitems.description: Resets the overlay view

Called by the view when the player clicks the discard button.

params.name: decrease

params.name: resource

params.name: amount
params.description: the current amount to display

classitems.description: Enables or disabled the discard button.
classitems.name: setDiscardButtonEnabled

params.name: shouldEnable
params.description: whether or not a player can discard yet

classitems.description: Sets the state message, which indicates how many cards a player has set to discard, and how many remain to set.
classitems.name: setStateMessage

params.name: message
params.description: the message to display

classitems.description: This method is called by the Rob View when a player to rob is selected via a button click.

params.name: orderID
params.description: The index (0-3) of the player who is to be robbed

classitems.name: robPlayer

classitems.description:
Starts the robber movement on the map. The map should pop out and the player should be able
move the robber.  This is called when the user plays a "solider" development card.
classitems.name: doSoldierAction

classitems.description:
Pops the map out and prompts the player to place two roads.
This is called when the user plays a "road building" progress development card.
classitems.name: startDoubleRoadBuilding

classitems.description: Pops the map out and prompts the player to place the appropriate piece

params.name: pieceType
params.description: - "road", "settlement", or "city

params.name: free
params.description: - Set to true in road building and the initial setup

params.name: disconnected
params.description: - Whether or not the piece can be disconnected. Set to true only in initial setup

classitems.name: startMove

classitems.description:
This method is called from the modal view when the cancel button is pressed. 
It should allow the user to continue gameplay without having to place a piece.
classitems.name: cancelMove

classitems.description:
This method is called whenever the user is trying to place a piece on the map. 
         It is called by the view for each "mouse move" event.  
         The returned value tells the view whether or not to allow the piece to be "dropped" at the current location.

params.name: loc
params.description: The location being considered for piece placement

params.name: type
params.description: The type of piece the player is trying to place ("robber","road","settlement","city")

classitems.name: onDrag

return.description: Whether or not the given piece can be placed at the current location.

classitems.description:
This method is called when the user clicks the mouse to place a piece.
         This method should close the modal and possibly trigger the Rob View.

params.name: loc
params.description: The location where the piece is being placed

params.name: type
params.description: The type of piece being placed ("robber","road","settlement","city")

classitems.name: onDrop

classitems.description: Shows a modal overlay of the map.
classitems.name: showModal

params.name: type
params.description: the type of the item to place: "Robber", "Soldier", "City", "Settlement", "Road".

classitems.description: Closes the overlay.
classitems.name: closeModal

classitems.description: The location of the vertex on the hex (allowed values:"E" , "W")
classitems.name: dir

classitems.description: The location of the edge on the hex (allowed values:"SW", "S", "SE")
classitems.name: dir

classitems.description:
The amount of rotation on the port - specifically, which side it faces:
 0 - NW
 1 - N
 2 - NE
 3 - SE
 4 - S
 5 - SW
classitems.name: rotation

classitems.description:
This starts the piece placement process - it has no knowledge of the model, so you must tell it the piece type and color.
Color can be omitted and has no effect if it's the robber
After calling this, the view will use the controller's "onDrag" and "onDrop" methods to check whether a piece can be placed.

params.name: objectType
params.description: The type of piece to be placed ("city","settlement","road","robber")

params.name: color
params.description: The color of the piece you want to place. (Omit for "robber".)

classitems.name: startDrop

classitems.description: This cancels the piece placement process.
classitems.name: cancelDrop

classitems.description: This causes the pieces on the board to be drawn.
classitems.name: drawPieces

classitems.description: This adds a hex to the board.

params.name: loc
params.description: The location to put the hex. This should only be called at most once per hex location

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the hex: a resource("wood","brick","sheep","wheat","ore"), "desert", or "water"

params.name: noDraw
params.description: Optional - if omitted or false, the view is not redrawn.

classitems.name: addHex

classitems.description: This adds a number to the board.

params.name: loc
params.description: The location to put the number. This should only be called at most once per hex location

params.name: number
params.description: The number to put on the map

params.name: noDraw
params.description: Optional - if omitted or false, the view is not redrawn.

classitems.name: addNumber

classitems.description: This adds a port to the board.

params.name: loc
params.description: The location to put the port. This should only be called only once per port

params.name: type
params.description: The port type: a resource("wood","brick","sheep","wheat","ore"), or "three"

params.name: noDraw
params.description: Optional - if omitted or false, the view is not redrawn.

classitems.name: addPort

classitems.description: This places the robber on the board. Subsequent calls move the robber.

params.name: loc
params.description: The location to put the robber.

params.name: noDraw
params.description: Optional - if omitted or false, the view is not redrawn.

classitems.name: placeRobber

classitems.description: This adds a settlement to the board.

params.name: loc
params.description: The location to put the settlement.

params.name: playerColor
params.description: The player color

params.name: noDraw
params.description: Optional - if omitted or false, the view is not redrawn.

classitems.name: placeSettlement

classitems.description: This adds a city to the board.

params.name: loc
params.description: The location to put the city.

params.name: playerColor
params.description: The player color

params.name: noDraw
params.description: Optional - if omitted or false, the view is not redrawn.

classitems.name: placeCity

classitems.description: This adds a road to the board.

params.name: loc
params.description: The location to put the road.

params.name: playerColor
params.description: The player color

params.name: noDraw
params.description: Optional - if omitted or false, the view is not redrawn.

classitems.name: placeRoad

classitems.description:
This sets the available players to rob: an array of objects of the form 
* { color:String,
* 	name:String,
* 	playerNum:int,
* 	cards:int}
classitems.name: setPlayerInfo

classitems.description:
This is called to fetch the game state from the server the very first time.
It should: 1) fetch the game state JSON from the server, 2) update the client model with the
returned data, 3) notify all client model listeners that the model has changed, and 4) invoke
the success callback function with the object received from the server.
classitems.name: initFromServer

params.name: success
params.description: - A callback function that is called after the game state has been fetched from the server and the client model updated. This function is passed a single parameter which is the game state object received from the server.

classitems.description:
Using this method sets the location on the hex and the right functions on all the edges and vertexes it has
I don't think you'll have to use this...
classitems.name: setLocation

params.name: location
params.description: - the new location of the hex

classitems.description: Use this to access the edge. You should never have to set new edge objects post initialization. So not setter.
classitems.name: getEdge

params.name: edgeDirection
params.description: - which of the hex to fetch

classitems.description: Use this to access the edge. You should never have to set new edge objects post initialization. So not setter.
classitems.name: getVertex

params.name: vertexDirection
params.description: - which of the hex to fetch

classitems.description:
This calls the HexGrid conructor with the right arguements given a radius to 
 create a regular hexgrid, with the reference 0,0 pointing to the middle
classitems.name: getRegular

params.name: radius
params.description:
The radius of the map, including the center. 
                       It's given in the json of the map. T
                       The width of the map in hexes is equal to (2 * radius - 1)

params.name: hex
params.description:
A constructor of your custom hex class that you use to instantiate new hexes.
                More copies are instantiated using the hex(.prototype).constructor property. So make sure you have it!
                This should be your own custom hex class, which in it's constructor call the base hex constructor

classitems.description: Returns an array of all the hexes. It's useful in order to iterate over them (using [].map)
classitems.name: getHexes

classitems.description:
Returns the hex at the give spot. If you used the 'getRegular' function to make this hexgrid,
 the hexLocation (0,0) will return the hex in the middle of the hexgrid.
classitems.name: getHex

params.name: hexLocation
params.description: - the location of the hex you want.

classitems.description: Returns true if there is a hex at the given location
classitems.name: hasHex

classitems.description:
Returns a list of hex locations that point to all the hexs 
currently stored in the grid
classitems.name: getAllLocations

classitems.description:
This method depends on the class derived from BaseContainer for a Edge implementing the method 'isOccupied'
returning true iff the container has a road
classitems.name: getEdges

return.description: all the edges that have roads in the hexgrid - the return type is actually your custom edge class

classitems.description:
This method depends on the class derived from BaseContainer for a Vertex implementing the method 'isOccupied'
returning true iff the container has a city/settlement.
Note, you'll still have to a method on the edge/vertex itself to get the city or settlement from it.
classitems.name: getVertexes

return.description: All the vertexes that have cities/settlements in the hexgrid - the return type is actually your custom vertex class

classitems.description: This represents a location of a hex on a hex grid.
classitems.name: equals

return.description: boolean Returns true if the other location has the same x,y

classitems.description: This represents a location of a hex on a hex grid.
classitems.name: getNeighborLocation

return.description: hexgrid.HexLocation Returns a location next to this one, in the direction of the 'hexDirection' given

classitems.description: Get the next logical location by traveling about the center ofthe hex in a clockwise direction
classitems.name: rotateAboutHexCW

classitems.description: Get the next logical location by traveling about the center of the hex in a counter-clockwise direction
classitems.name: rotateAboutHexCCW

classitems.description:
Edge and VertexLocation's have class-specific implementations

This function should return all Locations that refer to this spot on the map
classitems.name: getEquivalenceGroup

return.description: [Array] A list of equivalent locations including this one

classitems.description: Abstract function to be overridden in child-class
classitems.name: getNeighborVertexes

classitems.description: Abstract function to be overridden in child-class
classitems.name: getConnectedEdges

classitems.description:
Returns a unique string id for this location
        All locations in any equivalence group will have the same id string.
classitems.name: getIDString

classitems.description:
This function returns this Edge location as well as the edge location for
the other hex that this edge touches.
classitems.name: getEquivalenceGroup

return.description:
[Array] The list of all edge locations that this 
object is equivalent to (reflexive). Size = 2.

classitems.description:
This function returns this VertexLocation as well as the VertexLocation for
the other 2 hexes that this VertexLocation touches.
classitems.name: getEquivalenceGroup

return.description:
[Array] The list of all VertexLocation that this 
object is equivalent to (reflexive). Size = 3.

classitems.description: Returns the three edge locations connected to this vertex location
classitems.name: getConnectedEdges

classitems.description: An alias for '.getConnectedEdges' - you could use it in tree traversal?
classitems.name: getConnectedEdges

classitems.description: This function should return true if this edge or vertex is occupied. (ie it contains a city, settlement or edge)

overlay and allows you to place a road.

The action to take on clicking the resource bar settlement button. Brings up the map 
overlay and allows you to place a settlement.

The action to take on clicking the resource bar city button. Brings up the map 
overlay and allows you to place a city.

The action to take on clicking the resource bar "buy a card" button.

The action to take on clicking the resource bar "play a card" button. 
Should bring up the "play a card" overlay.

classitems.description:
Returns a newly created object that inherits properties from the
prototype object p.  It uses the ECMAScript 5 function Object.create() if
it is defined, and otherwise falls back to an older technique.
classitems.name: inherit

params.name: p
params.description: Non-null object. P stands for parent. It's the object to extend

classitems.description:
This function creates a new enumerated type.  The argument object specifies
the names and values of each instance of the class. The return value
is a constructor function that identifies the new class.  Note, however
that the constructor throws an exception: you can't use it to create new
instances of the type.  The returned constructor has properties that 
map the name of a value to the value itself, and also a values array,
a foreach() iterator function
classitems.name: enumeration

params.name: namesToValues
params.description: an object with named values

classitems.description:
This makes a function that can be set as an onclick, etc.
If the inputFunction is a string, the return function when run will
attempt to find that function on the inputObject. That means that it's 
possible to change the function on the inputObject without having to call
this again.

If the inputFunction is a function and not a string, then the function is stored.

In both cases, the returned function will take the inputFunction and run it
with any references to "this" in the inputFunction refering to the inputObject.
The args are passed and the "this" reference change is done using the 
native JS function "apply".
classitems.name: makeAnonymousAction

params.name: inputObject
params.description: The object to be refered to as "this" in the inputFunction

params.name: inputFunction
params.description:
The function that needs to be run. If it's a string, when
												it's requested to run it's looked up dynamically on the inputObject

params.name: args
params.description: An array of arguements to be passed to the inputFunction

return.description: A function that when run, will run inputFunction.apply(inputObject, args);
